summary: NFLX will start utilizing AI to help its users find content while redesigning its user interface and making content discovery more interactive . These moves will lower the number of customers dropping the service, increase its viewership, and raise the firm's ad revenue . The bank kept a $1,200 price target and an Outperform rating on the name .  NFLX shares have advanced 22% in the last month, while they have gained 15% in three months . The average estimate calls for its EPS to rise to $30.78 in 2026 . NFLX trades at less than 5 times its earnings .

Investors looking for stocks in the Broadcast Radio and Television sector might want to consider either Fox Corporation (FOX) or Netflix (NFLX) Fox Corporation and Netflix are sporting Zacks Ranks of #1 (Strong Buy) and #2 (Buy) right now . But which of these two stocks is more attractive to value investors?  The Value category of the Style Scores system identifies undervalued companies by looking at a number of key metrics . FOX currently has a forward P/E ratio of 10.15, while NFLX has a PEG ratio of 2.20 . The P/B ratio is used to compare a stock's market value with its book value .  FOX stands above NFLX thanks to its solid earnings outlook, and based on these valuation figures, we also feel that FOX is the superior value option right now . FOX holds a Value grade of B, while NFLX has a value grade of D .

Netflix Inc. has been such a strong performer that not even the threat of massive tariffs on films has been enough for investors to question its prospects . Recent gains come in the wake of an earnings report that featured record profits and a better-than-expected forecast .  Netflix stock is down 1.3% this week, but it is coming off an 11-day rally that hit 20%, the longest in its history . The company was also seen as insulated from the tariff war, but that got a gut check after President Trump said he plans to impose a 100% tariff on films produced overseas, calling them a national security threat .  Roku Inc. has dropped 19% this year with the streaming-video platform company giving a weaker-than-expected outlook last week . Warner Bros. has slumped 19% and Paramount Global has climbed 10.5% .  Estimates for Netflix’s net 2025 earnings have held steady over the past week . Analysts aren’t factoring tariff risk into their forecasts . “Wall Street is starting to view Trump as the boy who cried wolf,” said Frank Frank .  The stock trades at nearly 42 times estimated earnings, well below the company’s long-term average of nearly 70 . Netflix also trades at a sizable premium to Disney's 16.5 multiple .  Shein Group Ltd. and Temu saw double-digit sales declines in the week after raising retail prices to cover the costs of increased US tariffs . Nvidia Corp. Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang said that the market for AI chips in China could reach $50 billion in the next couple of years .  Super Micro Computer Inc. gave a sales forecast in the current period that fell short of estimates, disappointing investors . Hon Hai Precision Industry Co. will supply Mitsubishi Motors Corp. with an electric vehicle that will be manufactured in Taiwan .  Coherent Corp. (COHR US) Fastly Inc. (FSLY US) Groupon Inc. Groupon (GRPN US) and Groupon are among the companies listed .

President Donald Trump suggested levying a 100% tariff on movies and shows made outside America . Citi stated that Netflix (NFLX) has a means of reducing the negative impact of such duties on its financial results . The bank warned that the potential tariffs could lower NFLX's earnings per share by 20% in worst-case scenario .  NFLX shares have risen 15% in the last three months and advanced 28% so far in 2025 . NFLX is one AI stock that went up since the beginning of 2025, while popular AI stocks lost around 25% . If you are looking for an AI stock more promising than NFLX, check out our report about the cheapest AI stock .

Netflix has unveiled a new AI-powered search tool for iOS users . The feature will utilize OpenAI’s ChatGPT to provide users with a conversational discovery experience . Users can enter their preferences using natural phrases like “I want something funny and upbeat” or more detailed requests .  Tubi launched a feature that suggested movies based on a user's specific request . However, Tubi later discontinued the feature, probably because of low adoption .

Netflix is pushing out the major TV app redesign it started testing last year . Users will start seeing it in “the coming weeks and months” It’s unclear why the rollout has taken this long .  Netflix has updated its home screen with a new design . The most obvious change is the new navigation bar with some different menu options . A spotlight design at the top will also help Netflix highlight live events, such as NFL games .  Netflix is testing generative AI search on iOS as a “small opt-in beta” for iOS users . The feature will allow for queries like “I want something scary, but not too scary, and also maybe a little bit funny,” CEO Elizabeth Stone says .  Netflix has announced a new design for its mobile app . The new design follows a set of price hikes for the company in January . The company's standard ad-free plan jumped from $15.49 to $18 per month .  This post originally appeared at Fast Company.com . Follow us on Twitter @dailymailonline.com for more of our featured news stories .

Netflix is testing a short-form video feature at its first-ever product and tech event . Users can tap on buttons to watch the entire show or movie immediately, save it to their "My List," or share it with friends . The company also revealed several other upcoming plans for the service, including anAI-powered search tool .  The experiment rolls out globally in the coming weeks on iOS and Android devices . It’ll appear for users as a tab on the in-app homepage . Netflix is no stranger to experimenting with short-form video .  Netflix is testing a new feature called "Fast Laughs" The new test aims to reach a broader audience beyond just comedy fans . Shortcuts for "Search" and "My List" were moved to the top of the page . Netflix also has new "callout" badges that help viewers discover titles .  Netflix will quickly adjust their homepage to display similar recommended titles . Netflix is getting into short-videos with a new vertical-feed for mobile .

While the S&P 500 has fallen in 2025, these growth stocks are trading up 30% to 40% . The stock market has gotten off to a volatile start for 2025 . Some growth stocks have managed to climb significantly higher despite the uncertain future .  Share prices ofUber Technologies have climbed 42% since the start of the year through May 5 . The bull case for Uber is that they offer demand aggregation for autonomous vehicle companies . 171 million people around the world already use the Uber app every month for rides and delivery services .  Uber could end up being the biggest beneficiary of the rise of autonomous vehicles . It doesn't have to invest heavily in infrastructure or production, it merely operates the network . Uber's network effect can continue driving strong results well into the future .  Celsius is positioning itself well for another round of growth . Management expects to extract $50 million in cost savings within two years of closing the deal .  Netflix stock has rallied 28% higher in the month of April . Analysts have updated their estimates for Celsius over the last month amid tariff fears . At an enterprise-value-to-forward-EBITDA ratio of 16, the stock is worth buying right now .  Netflix's ability to raise prices on consumers is bolstered by the success of its ad-supported tier . With such strong engagement from its viewers, Netflix can charge a relatively low subscription rate while still generating very high revenue per user . Management expects its modest ad revenue to double this year .  Netflix stock has become relatively expensive after the run up in shares, with the stock trading for about 45 times forward earnings . Management has turned the media business into a massive free cash flow-generating machine . Over time, that should support very strong earnings-per-share growth . Economist Peter Schiffcriticized PresidentDonald Trump’s proposed 100% tariff on foreign-produced movies . Schiff suggested Netflix subscribers would ultimately bear the cost of the tax .  Film production has increasingly moved overseas to locations offering tax incentives . The policy comes as Netflix co-CEOTed Sarandos recently claimed the streaming giant “saved Hollywood” Critics warn that retaliatory tariffs could be a national security threat .  “The retaliation will kill our industry. We have a lot more to lose than to gain,” said William Reinsch, former senior Commerce official and Center for Strategic and International Studies fellow . Measures could harm U.S. interests . President Trump authorized the Department of Commerce and the USTR to immediately begin the process of instituting 100% tariff on any and all foreign movies coming into the US . The stock closed $10 off its high for the day at $1,134.06 . Netflix has been on a tear lately after testing its 200-day .
